sub_title: Head of Digital Built Environment Department at TNO
summary:
SUMMARY 
Head of TNO's Digital Built Environment department, focused on reseach and innovation in predictive digital twins and data-driven greenhouses. Background in applied mathematics, data science, scientific software engineering, project and research management. 

VISION AND AMBITION
Every day at my work I would like to grow as a professional, help my co-workers to develop, and make societal impact with innovation.

SPECIALTIES 
- Data Science, mathematical consultancy and scientific software engineering.
- Line management, account management, and project management.
- Agile/scrum, PRINCE2.

PROFILE
- Ambitious and enthusiastic person, who always strives to achieve the highest standard possible and to be supportive towards other people.
- Experienced professional with a proven track record in completing complex projects for commercial and government clients and published 10+ papers in high-impact journals. 
- Dedicated mathematical consultant, data scientist and lead, excelling in both an academic and commercial environment.

treasury_media.title: Predictive digital twins solutions for challenges in built environment
treasury_media.description: We are working on the next steps in the digitization of construction, namely the digital predictive twin. This is a digital replica of a physical structure, such as a bridge, which allows us to make predictions about its future behaviour. The digital twin provides timely insight into when it is time for maintenance, renovation or replacement of the physical twin. It can also simulate proposed changes to a building before these changes are actually made.

treasury_media.title: PROFILE Project Introductory Video
treasury_media.description: One of my TNO projects is PROFILE. In this project we focus on state-of-the-art data analytics and incorporation of new data sources for effective customs risk management. The project customizes solutions, that build on machine learning, graph-based analytics, and natural language processing, to help targeting officers and strategic analysts identify high-risk cross-border movements.

treasury_media.title: Artificial Intelligence - From research to application | TNO
treasury_media.description: My department at TNO deals with Artificial Intelligence (AI). AI concerns the ability of machines to demonstrate intelligent behaviour. AI is set to transform the way in which we live, work and travel. It will help us improve the competitiveness of Dutch industry and develop innovative solutions which will keep us healthy and safe. Our strength is to combine different AI technologies with multidisciplinary expertise in order to create responsible system solutions.

treasury_media.title: An SGBM-XVA demonstrator: a scalable Python tool for pricing XVA
treasury_media.description: Our most recent published paper in Journal of Mathematics in Industry. Together with Ki Wai Chau and Kees Oosterlee, we developed a Python demonstrator for pricing total valuation adjustment (XVA) based on the stochastic grid bundling method (SGBM). XVA is an advanced risk management concept which became relevant after the recent financial crisis. The strength of our new tool is its scalability with respect to the dimensionality of the underlying stock price processes.

treasury_media.title: TNO - innovation for life | TNO
treasury_media.description: I'm proud to be part of TNO. Working on different projects to contribute to innovation with the aim to serve the society.

projects.title: AI Oversight Lab
projects.description:
The development and application of reliable artificial intelligence (AI) is essential for increasing citizens' trust in AI. The challenge is to make existing algorithms more reliable and ethical, by investing in, among other things, good data use, increasing transparency, reducing bias and creating a clear picture of the effectiveness and embedding in a broader application process.

The existing ethical guidelines for reliable AI must be translated into best practices and concrete tools. Local governments can apply these when using AI methods, but software companies can also use them in the further development of AI methods.

The project mainly works on innovations around Trustworthy AI. Attention is paid to both theory (in the form of guidelines and criteria) and practice (concrete cases from governments and the development of practical tools).

contributors.headline: Head of Digital Built Environment Department at TNO

projects.title: Skills Matching
projects.description:
At present, there is still a significant mismatch between supply and demand on the labor market. Such as when formulating the vacancy text, in which requirements are set for a candidate, while other skills and competences are required in the workplace. In addition, it remains difficult to define an objective measure that an employer can use to rank and select candidates, which may also lead to employment discrimination. More prominent use of competencies and skills helps to increase the number of successful matches in the employee recruitment process.
 
In order to increase the number of successful matches and thus reduce the number of job seekers, it is essential to develop a dynamic approach to this, focusing on the skills required of employees to fulfill a job. AI plays a crucial role in this by using AI to better match CVs and vacancies in a transparent manner and with as little prejudice as possible (also referred to as bias). Moreover, this approach allows for better monitoring of changes and developments in the labor market in the areas of training, skills and professions.

Various AI innovations are used within the project, such as Hybrid AI, Responsible AI and skills ontology.

contributors.headline: Head of Digital Built Environment Department at TNO

projects.title: PROFILE
projects.description: PROFILE leverages state-of-the-art data analytics and incorporation of new data sources for effective customs risk management. The project customizes solutions, that build on machine learning, graph-based analytics, and natural language processing, to help targeting officers and strategic analysts identify high-risk cross-border movements. PROFILE also connects customs risk management systems to logistics Big Data and provides customs an improved access to online data, especially valuation-relevant data of e-commerce sites. PROFILE also strengthens cooperation and data exchange among customs and other competent authorities: PROFILE enables customs-to-customs systematic sharing of Entry Summary Declarations and other risk-relevant information through the EU-wide PROFILE Risk Data Sharing Architecture. With PROFILE solutions, customs administration can increase substantially the hit rate of inspections and their capacity to cope with transnational crime, terrorism, and the dramatic e-commerce-driven growth of customs declarations.

contributors.headline: Head of Digital Built Environment Department at TNO

projects.title: EU project: WAKEUPCALL
projects.description:
EU project WAKEUPCALL is a European Industrial Doctorates (EID) project, funded in the Horizon2020 framework. It is a Marie-Curie initiative in which six Early Stage Researchers (ESRs, like PhDs) work closely with industrial partners on a PhD thesis in applied mathematics. In this EID proposal we combine efforts among academic and industrial beneficiaries in three countries, Spain, Italy and The Netherlands. 

VORtech is involved as an industrial partner and will be responsible for partly supervising ESRs  and for organizing a scientific software engineering course.

profile_positions.description: The Digital Built Environment Department is part of TNO Mobility & Built Environment. It is located in Delft. The department consists of approximately 25-30 professionals, working on predictive digital twins, data-driven greenhouses, and other digitization challenges around buildings, infrastructure and maritime applications.
profile_positions.title: Head of Department

profile_positions.description:
The Data-Science Department of the Unit ICT of TNO consists of more than 50 professionals, located at mainly The Hague and Soesterberg. The department is specialized in e.g. Hybrid AI, Trustworthy AI, Knowledge Representation and Reasoning. 

Together with the research manager, we led the Data Science Department, where we connected with our team members and created an inspiring setting for them in which innovation, social value and close workplace relationships go hand in hand. On top of that, we made efforts to do research that makes a societal impact.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Head of Department

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for research and application projects at the Data Science department of TNO. Our department is headed in The Hague and Soesterberg, and consists of around 50 data-science experts. We focus on Explainable and Responsible Data Science (XRDS) and Connected Business (CB).

A selection of my past projects:

* AI Oversight Lab: a research and innovation project where we use Trustworthy AI to develop more reliable and fair algorithms for public authorities. See also: https://nlaic.com/en/use-case/ai-oversight-lab-developing-trustworthy-ai-algorithms-for-public-authorities/
* Skills Matching: a research and innovation project in collaboration with UWV and CBS to improve matching between jobs and employees, based on (hidden) skills and combining knowledge models and data-driven models. See also: https://nlaic.com/en/use-case/skills-matching-2-0-fair-decision-making-in-the-jobs-market-by-using-ai-in-recruitment-processes/
* PROFILE: a European H2020 project that leverages modern data analytics and new data sources for effective customs risk management for European customs. See also: https://www.profile-project.eu/
* Brains4Corona: early detection of COVID19 outbreaks using data-driven methods. 
* Customer intelligence: a B2B project where we serve the client by providing innovations on data analytics and privacy-preserving algorithms.
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
VORtech is a specialized engineering firm. It is focused on mathematical consultancy, data science and scientific software engeneering. It is involved in the development of high-quality computational and simulation software in the areas such as water management, process industry, geophysics, traffic and climate models, and finance.

As a senior mathematical consultant, I assisted various clients with our expertise in the fields of data science, scientific computing, applied mathematics, and scientific software engineering.

I was also responsible for the VORtech's business unit VORfinance, which serve the financial-oriented firms. As an account manager, I did marketing and sales, assist and advised clients in projects, collaborated with experts to solve complex problems. The key expertise of VORfinance is:

- Improving mathematical methods and algorithms;
- Speeding up software using High Performance Computing;
- Professional implementation of financial computational software;
- Applying data analytics to control, monitor and predict.  

Selection of past projects:

Client: NN Re
Role: Project leader / senior mathematical consultant
Environment: VBA / C / OpenCL / Windows
Activities: Performed a model scan on a prototype code on variable annuities, and provide guidelines to adopt an HPC solution. 

Client: TenneT / UMS Group
Role: Mathematical consultant / project leader
Environment: Excel / VBA / Windows
Activities: Translated a complex asset management problem and its requirements to a suitable mathematical model. Developed a software solution in Microsoft Excel.

Client: Shell 
Role: Scientific software engineer / mathematical consultant
Environment: Fortran / C / Linux
Activities: Improved mathematical components and investigated new algorithmic developments in seismic software packages.
profile_positions.title: Senior Mathematical Consultant | Project leader | Account manager

profile_positions.description:
Representative of Delft University of Technology in the TKI Switch2SmartGrids project called "Smart Grid Evolution: Developing a service platform for the Internet of Energy"​. Distribution system operators, industries, SMEs and universities are involved in this project. The aim of the project is find the most promising innovation concepts with which the emerging Smart Grid can be scaled up to 500.000+ connections by 2020 in The Netherlands. 

The project focuses on the ICT layer of the evolving systems of systems. To be effective the project will maintain strong connections to programs and projects in Horizon2020, the Dutch national Top Sector program and city driven initiatives such as the "Green Deal". It will further build on findings from the Innovation Program Intelligent Networks (IPIN).

My responsibilities included: 
- Do activities as a Work Package (WP2) leader and as a 3TU representative.
- Validate and verify the scientific ideas and mathematical models, which are used in the demonstration cases of the project.
- Provide and apply the expertise of the experts and scientists at Delft University of Technology to the project.
- Support and collaborate with the partners in the project by providing scientific and mathematical modelling expertise.
- Solve load-flow problems efficiently with advanced numerical tools.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Associate | Scientific Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Worked as a postdoctoral associate at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) of the University of Minnesota. I collaborated with Professor Yousef Saad on mainly the topic of  "Development of efficient petascale algorithms for inhomogeneous quantum-mechanical systems." 

* Explored new numerical linear algebra methods to extract entries of matrix inverses. 
* Collaborated with other scientists.
* Resulted in publications in SIAM SISC and NLAA. 
* Part of the work was also presented at the Copper Mountain conference, and was shortlisted for The HKIE Young Engineer of the Year Award.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Associate

profile_positions.description:
Worked as a pension consultant in the Actuarial and Employee Benefits division of Deloitte in The Netherlands. It forms an integral part of Deloitte’s Financial Advisory Services. 

Some of my activities: 

* Pension Accounting: Conducted actuarial calculations and preparing actuarial valuation reports based on US GAAP or IFRS standards for various clients. These included data preprocessing, analysis of calculation results, and communication with the client. 

* Pension Consulting: Examined and improved pension scheme of various clients. These included discussions and negotiations with the client and insurers, performing qualitative and quantitative analysis based on offers from insurers and wishes of clients, checking drafts of judicial documents, and preparing presentations and communication with works councils. 

* Established and supported an electronic newsletter of up-to-date pension-related articles. This newsletter was regularly distributed to selected Deloitte employees.
profile_positions.title: Business Analyst

profile_positions.description:
Worked as a PhD candidate at the Numerical Analysis group of Delft University of Technology. My advisor Professor Kees Vuik an I did mainly research on the topic ""Two-Level Preconditioned Conjugate Gradient Methods with Applications to Bubbly Flow Problems".

* Examined topics in numerical analysis and computational fluid dynamics. 
* Published in international proceedings and scientific journals such as SIAM SIMAX, JSC, and JCP.
* Collaborated with scientists from other faculties and foreign universities, such as TU Berlin. 
* Presented work at several (international) conferences, and was awarded prizes.
* Involved in teaching, lecturing and organizing activities.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description:
Internship at Shell was part of the final MSc project and was a collaboration with the numerical analysis group of Delft University of Technology. 

* Main activity: Examine the improvement of existing mathematical models for locating and searching for gas and oil in the earth's crust.
* Resulting thesis: "Construction of Combined Preconditioners for the Helmholtz Problem".
profile_positions.title: Trainee

profile_positions.company: RIVM National Institute for Public Health and the Environment
profile_positions.description:
Internship at RIVM and KNMI was part of the BSc studies. 

* Main activity: Conducted a statistical trend and uncertainty analysis based on historical data of the period 1901-2003. Consequently, climate changes could be further analyzed and predicted by the outcome of this study.
* Resulting thesis: "Detection of Changes in Climate Extremes and Weather-Related Indicators in The Netherlands"
profile_positions.title: Trainee

volunteer_experiences.description:
Pool West 3 is the official regional pool billiard district of the region of Rijnmond / Drechtstreek (Rotterdam and surroundings) and serves more than 300 registered members. 

Together with the president, secretary and a bunch of more volunteers, we determine the policy of the the pool billiard activities in our region. This includes organizing the official team leagues and individual ranking tournaments for beginners and advanced players.

The KNBB is the Royal Dutch Billiards Federation (KNBB) within the Netherlands. Sectie Pool is the pool billiards section of this organization. 

As a Secretary of the board of KNBB Sectie Pool, I am responsible for the administrative tasks of board meetings and other formal meetings. In addition, I do PR and marketing activities and I am responsible for the policy and implementation of different "breedtesport" (recreational sports) acitivities. This includes the Pool Ranking Nederland and the NK's (Dutch Championships).
